channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: Default
item.description: Argentina’s debt restructuring tests the theoretical limits of chaos theory. Gregory Makoff's feat is to build his narrative as a thriller without losing the detailed facts valued by specialists.

item.title: A WFH ‘culture war’ has broken out across Europe, with the U.K. leading the charge as the most WFH-friendly country, while France lags behind
item.description: Where in Europe is WFH winning?

item.title: Conundrum Cubed: Scope 3 for Financials
item.description: Proxy data and estimates are likely to play an important role in plugging disclosure gaps in financial institutions' Scope 3 emissions.

item.title: GE extends CEO Larry Culp’s contract through at least 2027 after successful turnaround—taking him out of the running to lead Boeing
item.description: Culp had been cited by analysts and others as a candidate to succeed Boeing’s Dave Calhoun, who has said he plans to step down by the end of the year.

item.title: Hedge Funds: A Poor Choice for Most Long-Term Investors?
item.description: By allocating to a diversified pool of hedge funds, many institutional investors are unwittingly reducing their equity holdings.

item.title: GameStop investor drops pump-and-dump lawsuit against ‘Roaring Kitty’ just 3 days after filing it
item.description: In a court filing late Monday afternoon, Radev said he was voluntarily dismissing the lawsuit.

item.title: Did Inflation Kill the CAPM?
item.description: While the immediate future may not be promising for the equity premium, it looks bright for factor premiums.

item.title: Australians now need a prescription to buy a vape under new ‘world-leading’ law
item.description: The law restricts vape sales to pharmacies and will temporarily require a doctor’s prescription for the buyer.

item.title: Behavior of Crowds not Wisdom of Crowds
item.description: When behavioral crowds are roiling the markets, as they are now, best idea active equity has an excellent chance of outperforming.

item.title: Butter prices jump to all-time high as more dairy producers shift to cheese while bird flu keeps U.S. output tight
item.description: Prices hit an average of $7,350 per metric ton on the latest Global Dairy Trade auction, surpassing a previous peak of $7,086 in 2022.
